content.question: A photon of wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> moves in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction toward an electron that is initially at rest, as shown in the “Before Interaction” figure. The photon and electron interact. The resulting photon of wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> and the electron move in the directions shown in the “After Interaction” figure. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lambda sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="lambda sub f equals lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because the photon momentum has a positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component before and after the interaction.

<math alttext="lambda sub f equals lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because the photon energy is the same before and after the interaction.

<math alttext="lambda sub f is greater than lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because the photon momentum has a positive <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component after the interaction.

<math alttext="lambda sub f is greater than lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because the energy of the photon-electron system is the same before and after the interaction.

content.answer: <math alttext="lambda sub f is greater than lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because the energy of the photon-electron system is the same before and after the interaction.
